newsArray.title: Cricket star Stuart MacGill allegedly threatened friendтАЩs ex
creator: Adelaide Lang
newsArray.description: A former Australian cricketer allegedly shouted a stream of obscenities at his best friendтАЩs ex before intimidating her at a pub, a court has been told.
newsArray.content: Former Australian cricket star Stuart MacGill allegedly screamed obscenities at his best friendтАЩs ex partner before he got into her face and intimidated her in a pub, a court has been told. The 51-year-old appeared in Sydney Downing Centre Local Court on Monday to continue to fight the charges of intimidation and using offensive language in a public place. Police allege the legendary spin bowler and his friend Stephen Kerlin, 54, verbally abused Samantha Lorraine Ford on Kent St in Sydney. The two men are accused of approaching the woman, who is Mr KerlinтАЩs former partner, on a corner near the Lord Nelson pub around 6pm on February 1. More than a year after the alleged intimidation, Ms Ford appeared in court and claimed the two men screamed swear words at her as they approached her. The court was told she had been returning to her home on Argyle St with a parcel in one hand and a poodle in the other when she heard тАЬloud shoutingтАЭ from a nearby street. тАЬThe first screams were loud so I looked up immediately and I recognised the two people,тАЭ Ms Ford said. She identified her former partner Mr Kerlin and his best friend Mr MacGill, whom sheтАЩd met before, as her verbal assailants. The pub owner said the pair were staring directly at her as Mr MacGill shouted that she was a тАЬc***y c**tтАЭ and an тАЬa**eholeтАЭ and told her she was тАЬgoing downтАЭ. The men allegedly approached Ms Ford until they were only 15m away and continued their verbal tirade. тАЬI was shocked, I stepped back a couple of paces,тАЭ she said. тАЬ(I felt) very very threatened and very scared.тАЭ Ms Ford told the court that Mr MacGill had been the instigator of the verbal attack but Mr Kerlin had joined in. She judged the pair to be тАЬhighly intoxicatedтАЭ but said тАЬStuart was in chargeтАЭ. тАЬStuart appeared тАж his voice was very loud, the volume was loud. He seemed very angry. It was intense,тАЭ she said. тАЬHis face was red, his pupils were тАж scary, they were wild.тАЭ After allegedly unloading the stream of insults on the pub owner, the court was told the men walked away towards the Captain Cook Hotel. Ms Ford told the court that she followed them to the licensed premises to ask the pub staff not to serve alcohol to Mr MacGill or Mr Kerlin in the interest of her safety. In a statement to police just a day after the incident, she explained she followed the pair because she wanted to tell Mr MacGill and Mr Kerlin not to threaten or abuse her anymore. тАЬI didnтАЩt want the events of the evening to escalate more, for them to go and drink more, considering my residence is 10m from the hotel,тАЭ she said. However, she claimed her entrance to the pub was blocked by the former Test cricketer. The court was told he was within armтАЩs reach when he leaned over her and allegedly intimidated her. тАЬStuart came up and said something like тАШf**k offтАЩ and тАШf**k off you c**tтАЩ and he said he was going to call the police,тАЭ Ms Ford explained. тАЬHe said тАШyou c**t, youтАЩre going down, youтАЩre not welcome hereтАЩ.тАЭ Ms Ford said the former spin bowler was тАЬthreateningтАЭ and appeared тАЬextremely angryтАЭ. тАЬI felt scared, very scared, intimidated, threatened,тАЭ she said. The court was told she subsequently backed down the stairs of the hotel, still clutching her parcel and poodle. Mr Kerlin pleaded guilty to intimidation and contravening an apprehended violence order last year. The hearing into Mr MacGillтАЩs charges continues before magistrate Christine Haskett. More to come

newsArray.title: India U19 teamтАЩs achievement has set a benchmark to inspire upcoming cricketers: Roger Binny
creator: IANS
newsArray.description: BCCI President and member of the 1983 Men's ODI World Cup winning team, lauded the Shafali Verma-led side for winning the inaugural U19 Women's T20 World Cup
newsArray.content: Home | Sport | India U19 Teams Achievement Has Set A Benchmark To Inspire Upcoming Cricketers Roger Binny India U19 teamтАЩs achievement has set a benchmark to inspire upcoming cricketers: Roger Binny BCCI President and member of the 1983 Men's ODI World Cup winning team, lauded the Shafali Verma-led side for winning the inaugural U19 Women's T20 World Cup By IANS Published Date - 08:00 AM, Mon - 30 January 23 File Photo New Delhi: Roger Binny, the BCCI President and member of the 1983 MenтАЩs ODI World Cup winning team, lauded the Shafali Verma-led side for winning the inaugural U19 WomenтАЩs T20 World Cup in South Africa, after beating England by seven wickets in the final at JB Marks Oval in Potchefstroom on Sunday. тАЬI take this opportunity to congratulate the India U-19 WomenтАЩs team for their title glory at the ICC Under-19 WomenтАЩs World Cup. The team played with a fearless approach and created history by winning the coveted trophy. This was the inaugural edition of the tournament and our teamтАЩs achievement has set a benchmark to inspire the upcoming cricketers in the country,тАЭ he said in an official statement. Also Read India lift inaugural U-19 WomenтАЩs T20 World Cup title after beating England The BCCI has also announced a cash reward of INR 5 crore for the victorious India U-19 team and members of the support staff led by head coach Nooshin Al Khadeer. тАЬThe India U-19 WomenтАЩs team has done the entire country proud with their stupendous success at the ICC Under-19 WomenтАЩs T20 World Cup. The Shafali Verma-led unit showed tremendous skill and grit to overcome the challenges and blazed their way to glory.тАЭ тАЬThe BCCI has always valued age-group cricket and the title triumph is another sign that womenтАЩs cricket in India is thriving. This success also highlights the depth of cricketing talent in the country and augurs well as we inch closer to the inaugural edition of the much-awaited WomenтАЩs Premier League (WPL) which will further fuel interest in womenтАЩs cricket,тАЭ said Jay Shah, Honorary Secretary, BCCI. Shafali Verma & Co produced a superb bowling performance coupled with some outstanding fielding to bowl out England for just 68. Fast bowler Titas Sadhu, off-spinner Archana Devi and leg-spinner Parshavi Chopra were accurate in their line and length and found enough help to pick two wickets each. Shafali, left-arm spinners Mannat Kashyap and Sonam Yadav took a scalp each in a dominating bowling performance. тАЬThe entire nation is proud of this remarkable feat by our young team. My best wishes to the India Under-19 team for their resounding title-winning performance in the inaugural edition of the ICC WomenтАЩs Under-19 World Cup 2023 in South Africa.тАЭ тАЬThey have been clinical in their performances throughout the tournament and it is a result of their hard work and perseverance that has helped us get that coveted silverware. We wish them all the best for their bright future,тАЭ said Rajeev Shukla, Vice-President, BCCI. The fielding, despite a few blips, was athletic with some exceptional catches taken as England never got going with the bat. In chasing 69, on a slow pitch and aiding spinners, India lost Shafali and Shweta Sehrawat in the first four overs. тАЬI extend my best wishes to the entire India Under-19 WomenтАЩs team on their title triumph at the ICC Under-19 WomenтАЩs T20 World Cup. The team and the members of the support staff strived for excellence and this special win is the result of those efforts.тАЭ тАЬThe team was relentless and always put up a solid effort with the bat, ball and in the field. The top honour is an outcome of being excellent in all three facets of the game,тАЭ said Ashish Shelar, Treasurer, BCCI. But Soumya Tiwari (24 not out) and Gongadi Trisha (24) shared a vital 46-run stand for the third wicket to complete the chase in 14 overs and give India their first-ever World Cup title in womenтАЩs cricket. тАЬI would like to congratulate all the members and support staff of the India Under-19 squad on IndiaтАЩs trophy-winning display at the marquee ICC WomenтАЩs Under-19 World Cup event. To show such maturity at such a young age and bring home the cup is applause-worthy. The BCCI is proud of this young team who have brought laurels to our country. Well done girls,тАЭ concluded Devajit Saikia, Joint Secretary, BCCI. Follow Us : Tags BCCI Roger Binny U19 Women's T20 World Cup Related News Hyderabad end Ranji Trophy season with Zero wins тАШGovernment should incentivise institutions to build infrastructureтАЩ Shreyas Iyer ruled out from New Zealand ODIs Viacom 18 bags media rights for WomenтАЩs IPL for 951 crore Rishabh Pant to be sidelined for majority of 2023 after tearing three key knee ligaments: Report Chetan Sharma retained as chairman of selectors

newsArray.title: Cricket star Stuart MacGill allegedly threatened friendтАЩs ex
creator: Adelaide Lang
newsArray.description: A former Australian cricketer allegedly shouted a stream of obscenities at his best friendтАЩs ex before intimidating her at a pub, a court has been told.
newsArray.content: Former Australian cricket star Stuart MacGill allegedly screamed obscenities at his best friendтАЩs ex partner before he got into her face and intimidated her in a pub, a court has been told. The 51-year-old appeared in Sydney Downing Centre Local Court on Monday to continue to fight the charges of intimidation and using offensive language in a public place. Police allege the legendary spin bowler and his friend Stephen Kerlin, 54, verbally abused Samantha Lorraine Ford on Kent St in Sydney. The two men are accused of approaching the woman, who is Mr KerlinтАЩs former partner, on a corner near the Lord Nelson pub around 6pm on February 1. More than a year after the alleged intimidation, Ms Ford appeared in court and claimed the two men screamed swear words at her as they approached her. The court was told she had been returning to her home on Argyle St with a parcel in one hand and a poodle in the other when she heard тАЬloud shoutingтАЭ from a nearby street. тАЬThe first screams were loud so I looked up immediately and I recognised the two people,тАЭ Ms Ford said. She identified her former partner Mr Kerlin and his best friend Mr MacGill, whom sheтАЩd met before, as her verbal assailants. The pub owner said the pair were staring directly at her as Mr MacGill shouted that she was a тАЬc***y c**tтАЭ and an тАЬa**eholeтАЭ and told her she was тАЬgoing downтАЭ. The men allegedly approached Ms Ford until they were only 15m away and continued their verbal tirade. тАЬI was shocked, I stepped back a couple of paces,тАЭ she said. тАЬ(I felt) very very threatened and very scared.тАЭ Ms Ford told the court that Mr MacGill had been the instigator of the verbal attack but Mr Kerlin had joined in. She judged the pair to be тАЬhighly intoxicatedтАЭ but said тАЬStuart was in chargeтАЭ. тАЬStuart appeared тАж his voice was very loud, the volume was loud. He seemed very angry. It was intense,тАЭ she said. тАЬHis face was red, his pupils were тАж scary, they were wild.тАЭ After allegedly unloading the stream of insults on the pub owner, the court was told the men walked away towards the Captain Cook Hotel. Ms Ford told the court that she followed them to the licensed premises to ask the pub staff not to serve alcohol to Mr MacGill or Mr Kerlin in the interest of her safety. In a statement to police just a day after the incident, she explained she followed the pair because she wanted to tell Mr MacGill and Mr Kerlin not to threaten or abuse her anymore. тАЬI didnтАЩt want the events of the evening to escalate more, for them to go and drink more, considering my residence is 10m from the hotel,тАЭ she said. However, she claimed her entrance to the pub was blocked by the former Test cricketer. The court was told he was within armтАЩs reach when he leaned over her and allegedly intimidated her. тАЬStuart came up and said something like тАШf**k offтАЩ and тАШf**k off you c**tтАЩ and he said he was going to call the police,тАЭ Ms Ford explained. тАЬHe said тАШyou c**t, youтАЩre going down, youтАЩre not welcome hereтАЩ.тАЭ Ms Ford said the former spin bowler was тАЬthreateningтАЭ and appeared тАЬextremely angryтАЭ. тАЬI felt scared, very scared, intimidated, threatened,тАЭ she said. The court was told she subsequently backed down the stairs of the hotel, still clutching her parcel and poodle. Mr Kerlin pleaded guilty to intimidation and contravening an apprehended violence order last year. The hearing into Mr MacGillтАЩs charges continues before magistrate Christine Haskett. More to come

newsArray.title: India U19 teamтАЩs achievement has set a benchmark to inspire upcoming cricketers: Roger Binny
creator: IANS
newsArray.description: BCCI President and member of the 1983 Men's ODI World Cup winning team, lauded the Shafali Verma-led side for winning the inaugural U19 Women's T20 World Cup
newsArray.content: Home | Sport | India U19 Teams Achievement Has Set A Benchmark To Inspire Upcoming Cricketers Roger Binny India U19 teamтАЩs achievement has set a benchmark to inspire upcoming cricketers: Roger Binny BCCI President and member of the 1983 Men's ODI World Cup winning team, lauded the Shafali Verma-led side for winning the inaugural U19 Women's T20 World Cup By IANS Published Date - 08:00 AM, Mon - 30 January 23 File Photo New Delhi: Roger Binny, the BCCI President and member of the 1983 MenтАЩs ODI World Cup winning team, lauded the Shafali Verma-led side for winning the inaugural U19 WomenтАЩs T20 World Cup in South Africa, after beating England by seven wickets in the final at JB Marks Oval in Potchefstroom on Sunday. тАЬI take this opportunity to congratulate the India U-19 WomenтАЩs team for their title glory at the ICC Under-19 WomenтАЩs World Cup. The team played with a fearless approach and created history by winning the coveted trophy. This was the inaugural edition of the tournament and our teamтАЩs achievement has set a benchmark to inspire the upcoming cricketers in the country,тАЭ he said in an official statement. Also Read India lift inaugural U-19 WomenтАЩs T20 World Cup title after beating England The BCCI has also announced a cash reward of INR 5 crore for the victorious India U-19 team and members of the support staff led by head coach Nooshin Al Khadeer. тАЬThe India U-19 WomenтАЩs team has done the entire country proud with their stupendous success at the ICC Under-19 WomenтАЩs T20 World Cup. The Shafali Verma-led unit showed tremendous skill and grit to overcome the challenges and blazed their way to glory.тАЭ тАЬThe BCCI has always valued age-group cricket and the title triumph is another sign that womenтАЩs cricket in India is thriving. This success also highlights the depth of cricketing talent in the country and augurs well as we inch closer to the inaugural edition of the much-awaited WomenтАЩs Premier League (WPL) which will further fuel interest in womenтАЩs cricket,тАЭ said Jay Shah, Honorary Secretary, BCCI. Shafali Verma & Co produced a superb bowling performance coupled with some outstanding fielding to bowl out England for just 68. Fast bowler Titas Sadhu, off-spinner Archana Devi and leg-spinner Parshavi Chopra were accurate in their line and length and found enough help to pick two wickets each. Shafali, left-arm spinners Mannat Kashyap and Sonam Yadav took a scalp each in a dominating bowling performance. тАЬThe entire nation is proud of this remarkable feat by our young team. My best wishes to the India Under-19 team for their resounding title-winning performance in the inaugural edition of the ICC WomenтАЩs Under-19 World Cup 2023 in South Africa.тАЭ тАЬThey have been clinical in their performances throughout the tournament and it is a result of their hard work and perseverance that has helped us get that coveted silverware. We wish them all the best for their bright future,тАЭ said Rajeev Shukla, Vice-President, BCCI. The fielding, despite a few blips, was athletic with some exceptional catches taken as England never got going with the bat. In chasing 69, on a slow pitch and aiding spinners, India lost Shafali and Shweta Sehrawat in the first four overs. тАЬI extend my best wishes to the entire India Under-19 WomenтАЩs team on their title triumph at the ICC Under-19 WomenтАЩs T20 World Cup. The team and the members of the support staff strived for excellence and this special win is the result of those efforts.тАЭ тАЬThe team was relentless and always put up a solid effort with the bat, ball and in the field. The top honour is an outcome of being excellent in all three facets of the game,тАЭ said Ashish Shelar, Treasurer, BCCI. But Soumya Tiwari (24 not out) and Gongadi Trisha (24) shared a vital 46-run stand for the third wicket to complete the chase in 14 overs and give India their first-ever World Cup title in womenтАЩs cricket. тАЬI would like to congratulate all the members and support staff of the India Under-19 squad on IndiaтАЩs trophy-winning display at the marquee ICC WomenтАЩs Under-19 World Cup event. To show such maturity at such a young age and bring home the cup is applause-worthy. The BCCI is proud of this young team who have brought laurels to our country. Well done girls,тАЭ concluded Devajit Saikia, Joint Secretary, BCCI. Follow Us : Tags BCCI Roger Binny U19 Women's T20 World Cup Related News Hyderabad end Ranji Trophy season with Zero wins тАШGovernment should incentivise institutions to build infrastructureтАЩ Shreyas Iyer ruled out from New Zealand ODIs Viacom 18 bags media rights for WomenтАЩs IPL for 951 crore Rishabh Pant to be sidelined for majority of 2023 after tearing three key knee ligaments: Report Chetan Sharma retained as chairman of selectors

newsArray.title: Cricket star Stuart MacGill allegedly threatened friendтАЩs ex
creator: Adelaide Lang
newsArray.description: A former Australian cricketer allegedly shouted a stream of obscenities at his best friendтАЩs ex before intimidating her at a pub, a court has been told.
newsArray.content: Former Australian cricket star Stuart MacGill allegedly screamed obscenities at his best friendтАЩs ex partner before he got into her face and intimidated her in a pub, a court has been told. The 51-year-old appeared in Sydney Downing Centre Local Court on Monday to continue to fight the charges of intimidation and using offensive language in a public place. Police allege the legendary spin bowler and his friend Stephen Kerlin, 54, verbally abused Samantha Lorraine Ford on Kent St in Sydney. The two men are accused of approaching the woman, who is Mr KerlinтАЩs former partner, on a corner near the Lord Nelson pub around 6pm on February 1. More than a year after the alleged intimidation, Ms Ford appeared in court and claimed the two men screamed swear words at her as they approached her. The court was told she had been returning to her home on Argyle St with a parcel in one hand and a poodle in the other when she heard тАЬloud shoutingтАЭ from a nearby street. тАЬThe first screams were loud so I looked up immediately and I recognised the two people,тАЭ Ms Ford said. She identified her former partner Mr Kerlin and his best friend Mr MacGill, whom sheтАЩd met before, as her verbal assailants. The pub owner said the pair were staring directly at her as Mr MacGill shouted that she was a тАЬc***y c**tтАЭ and an тАЬa**eholeтАЭ and told her she was тАЬgoing downтАЭ. The men allegedly approached Ms Ford until they were only 15m away and continued their verbal tirade. тАЬI was shocked, I stepped back a couple of paces,тАЭ she said. тАЬ(I felt) very very threatened and very scared.тАЭ Ms Ford told the court that Mr MacGill had been the instigator of the verbal attack but Mr Kerlin had joined in. She judged the pair to be тАЬhighly intoxicatedтАЭ but said тАЬStuart was in chargeтАЭ. тАЬStuart appeared тАж his voice was very loud, the volume was loud. He seemed very angry. It was intense,тАЭ she said. тАЬHis face was red, his pupils were тАж scary, they were wild.тАЭ After allegedly unloading the stream of insults on the pub owner, the court was told the men walked away towards the Captain Cook Hotel. Ms Ford told the court that she followed them to the licensed premises to ask the pub staff not to serve alcohol to Mr MacGill or Mr Kerlin in the interest of her safety. In a statement to police just a day after the incident, she explained she followed the pair because she wanted to tell Mr MacGill and Mr Kerlin not to threaten or abuse her anymore. тАЬI didnтАЩt want the events of the evening to escalate more, for them to go and drink more, considering my residence is 10m from the hotel,тАЭ she said. However, she claimed her entrance to the pub was blocked by the former Test cricketer. The court was told he was within armтАЩs reach when he leaned over her and allegedly intimidated her. тАЬStuart came up and said something like тАШf**k offтАЩ and тАШf**k off you c**tтАЩ and he said he was going to call the police,тАЭ Ms Ford explained. тАЬHe said тАШyou c**t, youтАЩre going down, youтАЩre not welcome hereтАЩ.тАЭ Ms Ford said the former spin bowler was тАЬthreateningтАЭ and appeared тАЬextremely angryтАЭ. тАЬI felt scared, very scared, intimidated, threatened,тАЭ she said. The court was told she subsequently backed down the stairs of the hotel, still clutching her parcel and poodle. Mr Kerlin pleaded guilty to intimidation and contravening an apprehended violence order last year. The hearing into Mr MacGillтАЩs charges continues before magistrate Christine Haskett. More to come

newsArray.title: India U19 teamтАЩs achievement has set a benchmark to inspire upcoming cricketers: Roger Binny
creator: IANS
newsArray.description: BCCI President and member of the 1983 Men's ODI World Cup winning team, lauded the Shafali Verma-led side for winning the inaugural U19 Women's T20 World Cup
newsArray.content: Home | Sport | India U19 Teams Achievement Has Set A Benchmark To Inspire Upcoming Cricketers Roger Binny India U19 teamтАЩs achievement has set a benchmark to inspire upcoming cricketers: Roger Binny BCCI President and member of the 1983 Men's ODI World Cup winning team, lauded the Shafali Verma-led side for winning the inaugural U19 Women's T20 World Cup By IANS Published Date - 08:00 AM, Mon - 30 January 23 File Photo New Delhi: Roger Binny, the BCCI President and member of the 1983 MenтАЩs ODI World Cup winning team, lauded the Shafali Verma-led side for winning the inaugural U19 WomenтАЩs T20 World Cup in South Africa, after beating England by seven wickets in the final at JB Marks Oval in Potchefstroom on Sunday. тАЬI take this opportunity to congratulate the India U-19 WomenтАЩs team for their title glory at the ICC Under-19 WomenтАЩs World Cup. The team played with a fearless approach and created history by winning the coveted trophy. This was the inaugural edition of the tournament and our teamтАЩs achievement has set a benchmark to inspire the upcoming cricketers in the country,тАЭ he said in an official statement. Also Read India lift inaugural U-19 WomenтАЩs T20 World Cup title after beating England The BCCI has also announced a cash reward of INR 5 crore for the victorious India U-19 team and members of the support staff led by head coach Nooshin Al Khadeer. тАЬThe India U-19 WomenтАЩs team has done the entire country proud with their stupendous success at the ICC Under-19 WomenтАЩs T20 World Cup. The Shafali Verma-led unit showed tremendous skill and grit to overcome the challenges and blazed their way to glory.тАЭ тАЬThe BCCI has always valued age-group cricket and the title triumph is another sign that womenтАЩs cricket in India is thriving. This success also highlights the depth of cricketing talent in the country and augurs well as we inch closer to the inaugural edition of the much-awaited WomenтАЩs Premier League (WPL) which will further fuel interest in womenтАЩs cricket,тАЭ said Jay Shah, Honorary Secretary, BCCI. Shafali Verma & Co produced a superb bowling performance coupled with some outstanding fielding to bowl out England for just 68. Fast bowler Titas Sadhu, off-spinner Archana Devi and leg-spinner Parshavi Chopra were accurate in their line and length and found enough help to pick two wickets each. Shafali, left-arm spinners Mannat Kashyap and Sonam Yadav took a scalp each in a dominating bowling performance. тАЬThe entire nation is proud of this remarkable feat by our young team. My best wishes to the India Under-19 team for their resounding title-winning performance in the inaugural edition of the ICC WomenтАЩs Under-19 World Cup 2023 in South Africa.тАЭ тАЬThey have been clinical in their performances throughout the tournament and it is a result of their hard work and perseverance that has helped us get that coveted silverware. We wish them all the best for their bright future,тАЭ said Rajeev Shukla, Vice-President, BCCI. The fielding, despite a few blips, was athletic with some exceptional catches taken as England never got going with the bat. In chasing 69, on a slow pitch and aiding spinners, India lost Shafali and Shweta Sehrawat in the first four overs. тАЬI extend my best wishes to the entire India Under-19 WomenтАЩs team on their title triumph at the ICC Under-19 WomenтАЩs T20 World Cup. The team and the members of the support staff strived for excellence and this special win is the result of those efforts.тАЭ тАЬThe team was relentless and always put up a solid effort with the bat, ball and in the field. The top honour is an outcome of being excellent in all three facets of the game,тАЭ said Ashish Shelar, Treasurer, BCCI. But Soumya Tiwari (24 not out) and Gongadi Trisha (24) shared a vital 46-run stand for the third wicket to complete the chase in 14 overs and give India their first-ever World Cup title in womenтАЩs cricket. тАЬI would like to congratulate all the members and support staff of the India Under-19 squad on IndiaтАЩs trophy-winning display at the marquee ICC WomenтАЩs Under-19 World Cup event. To show such maturity at such a young age and bring home the cup is applause-worthy. The BCCI is proud of this young team who have brought laurels to our country. Well done girls,тАЭ concluded Devajit Saikia, Joint Secretary, BCCI. Follow Us : Tags BCCI Roger Binny U19 Women's T20 World Cup Related News Hyderabad end Ranji Trophy season with Zero wins тАШGovernment should incentivise institutions to build infrastructureтАЩ Shreyas Iyer ruled out from New Zealand ODIs Viacom 18 bags media rights for WomenтАЩs IPL for 951 crore Rishabh Pant to be sidelined for majority of 2023 after tearing three key knee ligaments: Report Chetan Sharma retained as chairman of selectors
